intro: Acer platanoides subvar. auratum, commonly known as the golden maple, is a variant of the Norway maple. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow foliage that turns orange in the fall. The plant has palmate leaves with five lobes, and its bark is smooth and light gray. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers full sun to partial shade. This ornamental tree is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and landscapes.
